attributes.action: Close the ‘main residence’ loophole in UK property tax rules
attributes.additional_details: Recent reports show people declaring different ‘main residences’ to HMRC and councils to avoid the 3% stamp duty surcharge and reduce council tax. With taxpayers facing high burdens and public services under strain, this undermines trust and fairness. Align definitions, require consistency, and close the gap.
attributes.background: Align the definition of ‘main residence’ across taxes and councils, require consistent declarations to HMRC and councils, and close loopholes that let people avoid stamp duty or council tax by claiming different main homes.

rejection.details: You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
